title: Division of the Land
shortSummary: Joshua 18 details the process by which the remaining seven tribes of Israel receive their inheritance in the Promised Land. The chapter highlights the assembly at Shiloh, the surveying and division of the land by casting lots, and the specific allotment given to the tribe of Benjamin. This chapter underscores God's faithfulness in fulfilling His promise to give Israel their land and the importance of obedience in possessing it.
timeline: c. 1406 BC - The Conquest and Division of Canaan

keyCharacters.name: Joshua
keyCharacters.description: The leader of Israel who directs the surveying and division of the land among the tribes.

keyCharacters.name: The Levites
keyCharacters.description: The priestly tribe who receive no land inheritance because their inheritance is the priesthood and service to the LORD.

keyCharacters.name: The Tribe of Benjamin
keyCharacters.description: One of the seven tribes yet to receive their inheritance; their land allotment is described in detail in this chapter.

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: Mentioned as the servant of the LORD who previously gave the inheritance east of Jordan to Gad, Reuben, and half of Manasseh.

definitions.definition: The portable sanctuary where God’s presence dwelt among Israel during their wilderness journey and early settlement.
An ancient practice used to discern God’s will in decision-making, here used to fairly divide the land among tribes.
The land portion given by God to each tribe as their possession and fulfillment of His covenant promises.
Boundaries or borders of a tribal territory.

outline.heading: Assembly at Shiloh and Land Surveying Commissioned
outline.description: The Israelites gather at Shiloh where the tabernacle is set up, and Joshua challenges the remaining tribes to possess their inheritance. He appoints men to survey the land to prepare for dividing it, emphasizing the urgency of obedience to God's promise.

outline.heading: Surveying and Division of the Land
outline.description: The appointed men complete their survey and return to Joshua, who casts lots before the LORD to divide the land fairly among the tribes, demonstrating reliance on God’s guidance.

outline.heading: Allotment to the Tribe of Benjamin
outline.description: The chapter concludes with a detailed description of Benjamin’s territory, including its borders and the cities within it, showing the fulfillment of God’s promise to provide each tribe with a specific inheritance.

application: Trust God’s timing and commands to possess what He has promised, avoiding delay or slackness in obedience.
Seek God’s guidance in important decisions, recognizing His sovereignty as demonstrated through casting lots.
Value the spiritual inheritance and service of the Levites, remembering that God’s provision extends beyond material possessions.
Be diligent in fulfilling God’s purposes, just as the tribes were diligent in surveying and claiming their allotted land.

keyVerses.text: And Joshua said unto the children of Israel, How long are ye slack to go to possess the land, which the LORD God of your fathers hath given you?
keyVerses.significance: This verse challenges believers to act promptly and obediently in claiming God’s promises.

keyVerses.text: And Joshua cast lots for them in Shiloh before the LORD: and there Joshua divided the land unto the children of Israel according to their divisions.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the reliance on God’s sovereign will in the fair division of the Promised Land.

keyVerses.text: But the Levites have no part among you; for the priesthood of the LORD is their inheritance: and Gad, and Reuben, and half the tribe of Manasseh, have received their inheritance beyond Jordan on the east, which Moses the servant of the LORD gave them.
keyVerses.significance: This verse explains the unique spiritual inheritance of the Levites and the fulfillment of prior land allotments east of Jordan.
